attributes.action: If UK weather reaches 30degrees people should get sent home from work on pay.
attributes.background:
Comfortable working environment.
To hot to work indoors. I.e factory's etc or any buildingwith broken aircon or without any Aircon.
attributes.additional_details:
UK workers.
Factory's,call centers etc or any other place with no aircon facilities.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use national flags for party political purposes.
attributes.background: National symbols, e.g. the Union Jack and St George's Cross, are often used by political parties wishing to add legitimacy to their views. This means that symbols that should represent everyone, regardless of politics, ethnicity or religion, have become linked to particular political agendas.

attributes.action: I want the government to recognise  severe neuropathy as a disability
attributes.background: Neuropathy is a extremely painful progressive disease. Nothing can cure it,there is only treatment for the pain.It usually starts in the feet,then hands but eventually affects the whole body

attributes.action: To scrap Grades 1 - 9 and go back to A - U grading/marking.
attributes.background: There is no standardised system or coherent system that any one school can take and use. The system is failing children as schools are unsure how to use the new marking system so the children suffer. This petition is highlighting the need to revert back to simple but effective A - U marking.
attributes.additional_details: As teachers we have a duty of care towards our children and if we are unable to mark correctly, the Department for Education is setting schools and children up to fail. We have not seen any good positive need for this marking system and we are now angry at having to use it over and above a perfectly good marking system used for many years prior. Children’s minds should not be bogged down with a complicated marking system. Go back to A - U, keep it simple and teaching improves.

attributes.action: Allow Spouses of Work Permit Holders to apply for ILR based on Domestic Violence
attributes.background: In June 2016,I finally sought help about the Domestic Violence against me. It was just 1 month before my husband would have obtained his Indefinite Leave to Remain(ILR). He now has a criminal record and may not get ILR. I am not eligible to apply for DV ILR because he is neither British nor Settled
attributes.additional_details: Under UK Immigration Law, only partners of British nationals/settled persons facing domestic violence (DV) can apply for settlement.This law forces people with abusive immigrant partners to stay on in the marriage.I have worked in the UK as a legal adviser for 5+ years but endured intense DV.I spoke out a month before my immigrant spouse would have acquired settlement.Now, I cannot apply for settlement for myself/2 kids born in the UK, just because I did not endure violence for yet another month

attributes.action: Negotiate personal EU membership for certain categories of UK citizen.
attributes.background: Citizens with either: 1. A spouse with EU citizenship; or 2. Pension rights in an EU member state; have had their European homeland taken from them and their family lives crippled. Personal EU membership confirmed by an official passport endorsement would help to mitigate that injustice.
attributes.additional_details:
Under Personal Membership of the EU, eligible individuals would benefit from Non-discrimination and Citizenship of the Union as described in Part Two of the Consolidated Treaties and Charter of Fundamental Rights, Articles 18–25.
http://europa.eu/pol/pdf/consolidated-treaties_en.pdf#page=57

attributes.action: Get NHS backing for MAP vaccine for Crohn's disease and colitis cure
attributes.background: I am a Crohn's disease and colitis sufferer. Life is very difficult because there is no cure. There is a possible cure at the Kings college hospital. The trials cannot go ahead because there is not enough funding. Meanwhile IBD sufferers have to struggle with life. This vaccine could help cure IBD
attributes.additional_details: There are 250,000 people in the UK that suffer from IBD, over 80% need to have surgery to correct or remove the colon. It is a chronic disease which is debilitating. Prof. John. Hermon - Taylor has worked out that a bacteria found in cattle is transferred to humans with a weak immune system. I have to have lots of medication to get through each day and have been hospitalised because I cannot get a remission. Crohn's and colitis sufferers are desperate for a cure. The vaccine is ready to test

attributes.action: No fees for parents who wish to know info about their kids from social services
attributes.background: When couples separate, it's very difficult to iron out the terms when it comes to children and many end up in court. For a non residential parent, they must apply for information from social services and then pay a fee to get written information. None can be given by phone
attributes.additional_details: Bromley Council was contacted by a father to ask what is happening with he's daughter, as court cafcass reports stated problems with the health and education of he's child.  Social services said he must apply for freedom of information by form on their website. The letter he recieved back stated he needs to pay £10 fee plus obtain documents such as birth certificate for he's child. The mother has this so he also has to buy he's own at a cost. This info should be free once ID or rights proven

attributes.action: Abolish university fees: we should be entitled to free education.
attributes.background: Fees for attending university in England have rocketed. Now the government has announced that student maintenance grants will be replaced with loans in 2016, meaning that students could end up in up to £50,000 in debt.

attributes.action: NO guarantee for EU nationals in UK without equality for Brits in EU.
attributes.background: Brits were encouraged for 30 years to invest in EU by buying houses for their retirement in a favourable climate for their health. Is it the wish of the British people for over a million UK pensioners to lose everything they have worked for all their lives?

attributes.action: Add an option for "Protest / No Confidence" to all ballot voting options.
attributes.background: Rather than depending on spoiled ballot papers to count protest votes, introduce an official way for the voting public to express their democratic right to show that they have a political opinion, but they disagree with all the views of a campaign or political parties.
attributes.additional_details: There is a large number of the voting public who feel disenfranchised by our political parties and representatives, who feel like they have no representive or political voice. Spoiled ballot papers are not always clearly counted, and in the case of a referendum can be ignored completely. Having a specific option that allows the voting public to voice their desire to be involved, but that they are excluded from the current political parties, leaders or campaigns is essential for democracy.

attributes.action: Poll Leave the EU Voters their reasons and present this to the EU before Brexit.
attributes.background: Anti-EU sentiment is not exclusive to the UK. With a Brexit, it is clear the EU will need to implement reforms to prevent other Nations from following suit. Why wait for the UK to leave the EU before reforming? Poll those who voted Leave for their reasons (it is currently not clear). Present these.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU should use this poll result of Leave voters to present reforms. The UK can then vote again that with these reforms, do we still want to leave the EU? 

Some may argue that David Cameron already asked for reforms. However, it is clear few really actually believed the UK would vote to leave. Now that it is clear, ask why the people voted this way and the EU should present new reforms. 

EU reforms will need to come. The EU has the chance now to do so before a Brexit actually happens.

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading for all High Street Retailers
attributes.background: We lost something valuable as a country when Sunday became a normal shopping day rather than a day for family, rest and relaxation. The freedom of some to shop on Sundays comes at the expense of those who have to work to serve them when they might want to spend time with their families

attributes.action: Consider a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt, Secretary of state for Health
attributes.background: The Independent exposes the collusion of Jeremy Hunt,  Department of Health and the HEE  to impose junior doctor contracts. Health Education England is meant to be an INDEPENDENT body  responsible for the teaching and training of health care staff. Mr Hunt cannot be trusted with future of our NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
6th January 2017 article in the Independent 
Emails show Jeremy Hunt’s Department of Health 'colluded' with ‘independent’ body to impose junior doctor contracts
Emails seen by The Independent reveal collaboration with Health Education England, which provides NHS trusts with £3.65bn of funding every year

attributes.action: Introduce a phased ban on multiple point fishing hooks for all leisure angling
attributes.background: For future generations, the welfare and conservation of all native fish species will benefit from a phased UK ban on multiple point hooks for all leisure (sea, coarse and game) angling. This petition proposes to change government policy, restricting anglers to using one single fishing hook per rod.
attributes.additional_details: Leisure angling is one of our biggest recreational pastimes. Whether as a requirement or personal preference, fish should be returned to the water quickly and unharmed. Whilst conservation measures, including a ban on lead weights, help to protect native fish and other wildlife, leisure angling’s use of multiple point hooks remains its Achilles heel. Removal is more time consuming, increases fish stress and the likelihood of harm or death. There are no grounds for defending multiple point hooks.

attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid payments at the beginning of the next fiscal year.
attributes.background: We need to reallocate all funds to projects within the UK, such as homeless shelters built in every city in the UK with a full time GP, medical and social care staff including drug and alcohol abuse, PTSD, catering and educational facilities and education and retraining facilities.
attributes.additional_details: That for a period of one year no foreign aid be paid and that at the end of that year, the government then uses a jury picked in the same way as the current judicial system to hear each case of requested aid from foreign countries. Furthermore that a list of qualifying criteria is put in place prior to any allocation of funds. Such as no country with a GDP higher than ours can request money, that the goverent of the country is an elected one, that the country does not have a nuclear program.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for office buildings to keep interior lighting on after hours.
attributes.background: Whilst out and about London recently on a Saturday night, I was struck by how many empty office buildings were lit up across the city with nobody at their desks. This is a massive waste of energy and resources and flies in the face of the Government commitment to reducing carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Make driving 25mph or more UNDER the speed limit a punishable offence.
attributes.background: When driving on dual carriage ways or 50mph A roads getting stuck behind drivers who are driving at a speed significantly slower than the speed limit set is a common occurence. It causes unnecessary over taking and can potentially be as dangerous as someone speeding. It needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Install speed cameras along the A52 from Priory island to Bramcote island.
attributes.background: To many people are tragically losing their lives along this stretch of road as people see it as a race track, I propose that speed cameras are installed to deter and hopefully lower the number of deaths that occur on this road.
attributes.additional_details: After a tragic accident on the 25th November 2016 that killed 2 people because of dangerous driving, this could have been prevented with speed cameras.

attributes.action: To lower the legal driving age to16 in the UK
attributes.background: I would like to lower the legal driving age to 16 as at this age you can take on many adult responsibilities such as paying tax, join the army, leave home, pay adult tickets on public transport.
attributes.additional_details: The Australian process of learning to drive is three fold where learners are required to log their driving experience throughout the learning. Young adults must display the relevant 'P' plates to show the stages of learning they are at such as Red P plates to green P plates to full license.

attributes.action: Oblige UK banks to provide instant debit card cash deposits in the Post Office
attributes.background: The Banks’ closure programmes are unfair, particularly to their rural customers, personal & small business, and those who cannot travel far. The Government must oblige all UK banks to provide instant debit card cash deposit facilities via the Post Office as part of their branch closures programmes
attributes.additional_details:
Presently, just a few banks allow customers to deposit cash using their debit cards.
The bank closures are forcing personal & small business customers to deposit cash in a local Post office using the customer's paying-in slips, with delays of 2-3 days before crediting the customer's account: This is profitable to the banks to the cost of their customers.
This petition asks the Government to only allow future bank closures, if the bank has put actions in place to stop this unfair practice.

attributes.action: Stop phone  calling. Make it illegal to withhold a company phone number.
attributes.background: Anonymous phone calls, often 10 a day are causing great distress to many people especially the elderly. The telephone preference service does not work; companies either ignore it or say that we contacted them or showed interest when we did not. They are an unacceptable nuisance.

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls!
attributes.background:
Their is no need for the Severn bridge to have tolls! It is proven that they don't need it anymore. It makes 90 million and the mantence costs are 15 million...so where's the rest of the money going?! 

You don't pay to go to Scotland....so why do we have to pay to go to Wales.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 overall revenue from the tolls was over £90m, while it had been suggested that maintenance costs amounted to between £13m and £15m.

It would be a major boost for the Welsh ecomony, but it is getting held back from getting that vital boost.

attributes.action: A 2nd EU Referendum to be held with Compulsory Voting for the Eligible.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to Conduct a 2nd Referendum with Compulsory voting  for all who are eligible, with an abstention option on the ballot paper. This will give a true majority of the UK voters wishes regarding the EU and a true mandate to Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The British Election Study asked a question on whether people regretted how they voted or not. Only 1% of people who voted Remain said they regretted their vote, but 6% of people who voted Leave said they regretted their vote.

attributes.action: Start making Gazumping Illegal.
attributes.background: We put in an offer for a House about 3 weeks ago it got accepted. Mortgage approved everything. Then Tuesday 1st November 2016 got told that someone put in a Higher  offer and that got accepted. So now left High and Dry.
attributes.additional_details: We don't want this happening to other people

attributes.action: Make it law that qualified electricians are allowed to break seals on cutouts
attributes.background: It is time that us electricians of which are highly trained and aware of electricity at work act do our jobs.
attributes.additional_details: Jobs can become more expensive and time consuming relying on an already over stretched national grid.  Just as BT had to open openreach allow electricians the right for basic electrical connections and force national grid to sell new seals.

attributes.action: Find accommodation for all unaccompanied children stranded in  Calais Jungle
attributes.background:
1500 children stranded in containers and tents around the area known as the Jungle in Calais urgently need appropriate housing 
& support,
 To leave unaccompanied minors who have been left to fend for themselves  is immoral, unsafe and reckless.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/the-calais-jungle-has-become-like-lord-of-the-flies-with-1500-children-left-behind-in-containers-and-a7388021.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/calais-jungle-latest-refugee-children-unaccompanied-minors-camp-migrants-destroyed-relocated-moved-a7386551.html

attributes.action: The British Government should apologize for the Balfour Declaration.
attributes.background:
The British Government promised a land that was not in their possession. They should claim partial responsibility for the suffering of the Palestinian people. 
The Palestinian people deserve an apology.
attributes.additional_details:
The Palestinian people need support and Israel needs to be pressured. I believe we should have two states for two people. 
The British government needs to support the Palestinian people in their pursuit of statehood.
The best way to start will be by apologising to the Palestinian people.

attributes.action: Stop the Heathrow Airport expansion
attributes.background: The UK government decided to build another runway at Heathrow Airport. This topic has been up for debate for many months & out of the 2 largest airports (Heathrow & Gatwick), the UK Government felt that another runway should be added to Heathrow. Since the news broke out, social media has received
attributes.additional_details: thousands of people expressing their concern on the #HeathrowExpansion, stating that this should have gone to Gatwck . Heathrow itself, is already a mega sized airport & as a local resident, I can tell you how bad it can be with the noise & the releasing of jet fuel on the local resident houses & the other problem is that, they are promising jobs, but what about job loses! All it takes is another major attack, & people will not fly as much, which will lead to pressure on airlines & job losses.

attributes.action: Let the victims decide who should next head the Westminster abuse.inquiry.
attributes.background: Someone who is trusted or members of the public should put forward respectable candidates from which the victims should choose the head of the inquiry. The main qualification required by potential candidates is integrity.
attributes.additional_details: WE MUST HAVE ANSWERS

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd for denying visa to bone marrow donor.
attributes.background: May Brown, 23, from Dorset, who has leukaemia, has been told that her Nigerian sister Martha is a "10 out of 10" tissue match.  However, the Home Office denied a visa because "all visa applications must be assessed against the immigration rules".
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-dorset-37656377

attributes.action: As with perjury, hold politicians in contempt of the realm if they lie publicly.
attributes.background:
Perjury: the offence of wilfully telling an untruth or making a misrepresentation under oath.
If you lie in court you can be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of up to 7 years. 
If you are a politician however, who lies under oath religiously to the public, then you usually receive a promotion.
attributes.additional_details:
We have recently seen the effect of such lies told to the country, yet those responsible for their gross misrepresentations continue to enjoy their profession having never been held legally accountable for the horrendous damage caused by their deceitful rhetoric. 

Make lying to the public, whilst in office, the same offence as lying in court.

attributes.action: The Royal Marines Calendar should be allowed
attributes.background: Allow the Royal Marines to release thier annual calendar to raise money for essential charities. If the government cannot fund the charities the Royal Marines want to support, then allow them to raise the money by making a calendar!

attributes.action: Make it law to carry a breakdown warning triangle in every motor vehicle.
attributes.background: If a warning triangle is displayed 100 metres behind a broken down vehicle, it will decrease the chances of someone else crashing into it. What if you had broken down somewhere awkward like a roundabout or a bridge without a hard shoulder?
attributes.additional_details:
It is already mandatory in France to carry a warning triangle.

It alerts other road users to a breakdown so they have enough time to react.

It is very effective on motorways where there is no hard shoulder.

It is known to reduce the amount of accidents involving broken down vehicles.

attributes.action: Ban the use of button batteries in children's toys
attributes.background:
The UK is seeing a large increase in serious injuries, and in some cases death, from children swallowing button batteries. 
At the same time, we are seeing an large increase in the use of button batteries in children's toys. 
Surely this cannot be coincidence?
attributes.additional_details:
Why are we using several button batteries when a single AA or AAA battery would do the same job with a minimal increase in size? 
AA type batteries are much less appetising to toddlers and babies who have managed to open their toys to reveal a potentially fatal prize, as well as being much harder to swallow.
My toddler hasn't been injured, thankfully, but when I started to think about how many of his toys contain 3 or 4 of these batteries each, I became quite concerned.

attributes.action: Make it law that animals microchips come with a tracking device
attributes.background: Get these dogs and cats safe by having a microchip with a tracker in it and then people can locate their pets when they go missing

attributes.action: Make ASLs (Bicycle boxes) illegal for motor vehicles to stop or rest in.
attributes.background: The Advanced Stop Line (Bicycle box) is consistently and wrongly used by motor vehicles stop in, despite it not being allowed, it's not a fineable offence unless an officer sees one enter it. They are there for cyclists safety and should be treated like yellow box junctions by motor vehicles.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for stroke survivors
attributes.background: Make prescriptions free of charge on any medication for stroke survivors

attributes.action: Ban junk food and fizzy drinks companies from advertising
attributes.background:
There is no arguing that marketing companies make an impact. Food and drinks companies have some of the best marketing in the world. 

If we can eliminate advertising of fizzy drinks and junk food, we can work to really reduce the obesity epidemic which the western world is in the grip of.
attributes.additional_details:
There was a time where Santa's suit was Green, Red or Tan depending on the person drawing it, then Coca Cola came along and used Santa as part of their Christmas marketing drive and since then we've all come to know the jolly fat man in the red suit.

Advertising is extremely powerful and has a huge influence on the purchasing decisions of our nation. A ban on these companies would very likely decrease the sales of unhealthy goods in this country and help to decrease the obesity epidemic.

attributes.action: Lower the 20% and bring back the 17.5% rate of VAT
attributes.background: Years ago the government raised VAT to 20 percent from 17.5 percent, when Great Britain ran out of money and the recession was looming. Years on, the Government has said time and time again we are out of a recession and jobs are at a record high. It's time to give families back their extra money.

attributes.action: Stop foreign workers taking British jobs in culturally important industries
attributes.background: We petition the Government to apply any immigration controls implemented Post Brexit to all industries, even culturally important ones, with very few exceptions even if the company or foreigner is extremely rich. Especially where there are young British people eager to do the jobs with the skills
attributes.additional_details: This must be applied to all, particularly to Sports clubs and especially football. The only exception should be that each club is allowed 1 coach & 1 player to be non Brit. The invasion of football with foreigners is hurting the ability of young Brits to develop & gain experience, this is hurting the national team. There are 100's of talented young Brits who could fill these roles so foreigners aren't required. Culturally significant industries are Sport, Media and Show business.

attributes.action: Give prisoners the right to vote
attributes.background: The European Court of Human Rights has told the UK it is violating a human right by not allowing prisoners to vote.The Government is choosing to ignore this, however this is preventing a true democracy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://fullfact.org/law/votes-prisoners-politics-versus-human-rights-law/

attributes.action: National vote to Legalise right to die
attributes.background:
Let there be a nationwide referendum to vote for the right to die,
In extreme circumstances A person should have the right to choose to legally and safely end their life

attributes.action: Independent scrutiny into Lancs Teaching Hospitals handling of A&E downgrade
attributes.background: On 13th April 2016, it was announced that A&E department would be downgraded to an Urgent Care Centre. LTH said the A&E department would reopen in August but have now confirmed it will stay closed until a review in April 2017.
attributes.additional_details: There now needs to be an independent oversight and scrutiny of the decisions and actions taken by the CEO and board of Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust. The Health Select Commitee and Department of Health need to intervene in the ongoing situation at Chorley and South Ribble A&E.  It is imperative the management of LTH is held to account for their decisions and actions around the downgrade of the A&E department in April 2016 and subsequent actions taken to reinstate A&E.

attributes.action: Force advertisers to label manipulated images and provide link to original media
attributes.background: Our children and young adults are surrounded by media portraying unnatural and mostly unattainable body images. In many cases that media has been considerably digitally manipulated (eg, airbrushing) and I propose legislation for such images to include a link to the original unenhanced image.
attributes.additional_details: Many studies and reports show the negative effect on our younger generation of being constantly subjected to images of such extreme and artificial body images. By forcing the producers of such media to include a link to the original image (by way of, say, a reference number or QR code or similar) the media would be more transparent to such harmful image manipulation.

attributes.action: Change the 40 year rolling exemption for classic vehicles to 30 year.
attributes.background: I feel that the standard should be revised from 40 years to 30 years. Many cars over 25 years now are classic cars and are on classic car policys which do little mileage per year. Cars over 20 years are rarely seen on the road on a daily basis so I think the above should be revised.
attributes.additional_details: My vehicle is a classic car and is 26 years old. It is on classic car insurance as there are only 30 of my vehicle on the road and is classed as a classic vehicle by my insurer so why shouldn't I get historic car status in 4 years time.

attributes.action: home buyer's consumer rights must be protected better with tighter regulations.
attributes.background: The rights of the home buyer must be protected with more stringent regulations.  Consumer rights for home buyers must be implemented and enforced. Legislation must force builders to resolve items (floor area, design etc) prior to sale. stronger regulation must be enforced for after sale responses.
attributes.additional_details: I purchased a new build on help-to-buy from a reputable builder who benefitted (£600 million in bonuses alone) by miss-selling their houses. The floor space of the house is 6.5% less than advertised. The losses are significant based on the correlation of area to price.The NHBC guarantee provided for new homes must protect interests of the home buyer from the builders. This is a failing system. The advertised floor area and design must be proven before the sale with the right to cancellation.

attributes.action: Make it law for individuals to return footballs if they land on their property
attributes.background: 1000's of footballs are held hostage each year by individuals who assume rights to the ball once it lands on their property. As parents of a very keen footballer, this has cost us a small fortune over the years and we would like to ask government to address this very hazy and unclear subject.

attributes.action: Ban personal and commercial drone flights over residential properties
attributes.background: ​Following the recent approval from The Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) granted to Amazon to test its aerial vehicles without several of the flying restrictions rules, we the undersigned seek to ban all drone flights at any height over residential properties and privately owned land.
attributes.additional_details: With the usage of drones by hobbyists, individuals and organisations on the increase we are concerned that privacy will be compromised, and catching any offenders will be near impossible. The risk of harm through drone faults will increase. Drones will be used by criminals to spy and transport illegal items. Noise pollution will increase and it will no doubt cause many homeowners to feel uncomfortable & insecure in their own back garden.

attributes.action:
Car Tax Refund takes too long
Should be immediate from the day car sold
attributes.background:
There is no period of grace buying a car to taxing it The DVLA obtain immediate monies
Refund from selling a car takes up to 6 weeks.
You only get the refund from the following full month. That means there is an awful lot of surplus cash sitting somewhere. 
This practice needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
If a bank held onto our cash without letting us have our money there would be an outcry. Why should the DVLA hold onto our money.
As soon as a car is taxed online the DVLA must be made to give an immediate refund on the car that has been sold. Money is taken electronically therefore should be refunded electronically.
